utterance.speaker: BRUNO TOFT
utterance.content: Keep this going, people! This is a big night for us.

utterance.speaker: BRUNO
utterance.content: You! Get it together man! Focus!

utterance.speaker: LUCAS SHAW
utterance.content: Yes, Chef.

utterance.speaker: BRUNO
utterance.content: Table 21. Order in, Appetizers, one chutes de cruet, one pork belly, two salmons, one squab, one quail. Lovely. Off it goes.

utterance.speaker: ERIC VAUGHN
utterance.content: Look. Here we are.

utterance.speaker: SERVER
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Enjoy.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Well, bon appetit, everyone.

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR FELDER
utterance.content: So, Eric. How would another $20 million for MexiSolar sit with you? Once I’ve seen that factory.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Enough business. Eat. Drink. Be merry, for once in your life, huh?

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: My God, this food is sublime.

utterance.speaker: NEIL MORRIS
utterance.content: I should hope so. This is the toughest reservation in the city.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Arthur?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Someone call 911!

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Now you’re dead. You can suck it. Oh, you want more? Come get it, buddy. ‘cause I got something special for you.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: And I’ve got something special for you, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that’s not looking too good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Castle -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then stick your head out, Patel, and get pwned like a real man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s Patel?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s this kid from India. He’s been thrashing me for weeks but not tonight. Because tonight I am bringing it. And it stings, doesn’t it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it kinda does. Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you rather play with a kid in an imaginary world, or with – – in the real world?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … … I … ooh. I – uh … uh …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God, you actually have to think about this!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No - Nope. I don’t have to think about it. Come over here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you kidding me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Forget it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, I died on purpose for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, what? No, I – it’s not my mom. It’s worse. Yeah, see ya Thursday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. You know how I get when I’m gaming. I was – I was in the zone. I was like Gretzky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well at least Gretzky knew how to score.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ouch. Okay, look – I’m, again, I’m very, very sorry. Do you forgive me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Castle, it wasn’t too long ago when me wearing a sexy outfit would get an immediate response from you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you saying, that I’m taking you for granted?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. Are you?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. Victim’s over here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Name is Arthur Felder, 54. He’s a wealthy venture capitalist. Witness said that he took one bite of his squab and did a nosedive into his plate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so this was not an allergic reaction.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: There’s no sign of anaphylaxis, but his enlarged pupils and excessive saliva suggest a foreign substance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was poisoned.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks that way but I won’t know for sure until I run a tox screen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how many people had access to the food before it was delivered?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Esposito’s checking on that right n – - ow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that Eric Vaughn?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. He was part of the victim’s dinner party. He’s a billionaire inventor, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Inventor, innovator, and number 8 on my LSL.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: LSL?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Last supper list. You and a table of 12 with anyone from history. What is mine, you ask? I’m glad you did. In order it is, Lincoln, Einstein, Ian Fleming, John Lennon, Joan of Arc, Sinatra – And you, of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Too late, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who made the reservations?

utterance.speaker: PETRA VASKER
utterance.content: I did. About a week ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did anyone else know that Mr. Felder would be here tonight?

utterance.speaker: NEIL
utterance.content: His office, but I have no idea who they might have told.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Vaughn? Excuse me? Hey.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Fantastic, thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is a murder investigation. I’m gonna need your full attention.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: I’m so sorry. That was my pilot. Arthur’s family is in the Caribbean and I was arranging for my plane to bring them home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well … that’s very … generous of you, Mr. Vaughn.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Oh, please. Call me Eric. And you are?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, I’m Detective Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I am Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Ah, the writer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: My mother loves your novels.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll get her an autographed copy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how well did you know our victim?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: We’d been doing business for many years, but we weren’t close, I’m afraid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea who would want him dead?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: None. This – this whole thing is terrible.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So normally only a handful of wait staff handle each entrée, but in this case it could have been somebody from the outside. There was a kitchen door propped open and CSU found this waiter’s vest stashed in dumpster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, have unis canvass the area and I’m gonna want to interview all the kitchen staff as well.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks as though Vaughn is on your list as well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Things you notice when you’re paying attention, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CORY
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve been a busboy there for 2 years.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So where were you at 8:20?

utterance.speaker: CORY
utterance.content: 8:20? Uh … I was at a back sink scraping dishes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Did you happen to see anyone in the kitchen that you didn’t recognize?

utterance.speaker: CORY
utterance.content: Yeah, you know, someone brushed past me. Um, I didn’t get a good look, but I remember thinking that he wasn’t familiar.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: CORY
utterance.content: No, not really. He was short. Dark hair, maybe. Things move fast in the kitchen, so I only caught him out of the corner of my eye.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tell me about that back door. Is it always open?

utterance.speaker: CORY
utterance.content: It shouldn’t be.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, so it looks like our victim, Arthur Felder, wasn’t the most fuzziest of guys. He made his fortune in hostile takeovers. A couple of weeks ago he shut down a chemical plant in Newark and sold it off for parts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It says here that 200 people lost their jobs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and according to his assistant, they got quite a few death threats after they announced the closing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Corporate raider shutters a chemical plant and ends up eating crow. Or in this case, poisoned squab. It’s poetic. Diabolically speaking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Castle and I’ll talk to Lanie and see if there’s any connection between the poison and the plant. In the meantime, why don’t you guys go through the list of people that made threats and see if anyone was in the vicinity of the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Sorry, it’s not a match for any of the chemicals manufactured by that plant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what was he poisoned with ?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Something exotic enough not to show up on a chem and unknown toxin evaluation. I’m running further tests, but all I can say for sure is that it’s some sort of paralyzing agent. Speaking of paralyzing agent, can I just say, Eric Vaughn?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See, Castle? He’s on everybody’s list.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, yes, he’s quite impressive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And handsome.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And don’t forget rich. And that accent? Oh, honey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I know!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right! Okay, um … I admit, all right, just as lesser men aspire to be me, he’s who the mes of the world aspire to be, okay? But that it not going to help us solve Arthur Felder’s murder. Finding out what he was poisoned with will.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, I can tell you this. Whatever the poison was was chemically synthesized and incredibly fast acting. The mushrooms he was eating never even made it to his stomach.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. Wait, mushrooms? I saw the menu. The mushrooms were served with the quail, not the squab.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. But Ryan said that Felder had the squab.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS SHAW
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s my handwriting and it’s right here on the ticket. Mr. Felder ordered the squab.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we have reason to believe that he actually ate the quail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The poisoned quail, Lucas. How did he end up with it?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Oh no. I must have made a mistake. I’m still learning the spring menu and the quail with the mushrooms looks a lot like squab with the artichoke hearts. And Chef was screaming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you mixed up the orders.

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, if Felder ordered the squab then who ordered the quail?

utterance.speaker: LUCAS
utterance.content: Yeah, here it is. The quail was supposed to go to Eric Vaughn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Felder wasn’t the intended target. They were trying to kill Vaughn.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: You mean to say that poison was meant for me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It seems that way.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Oh good God. What are we going to tell Arthur’s wife?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Vaughn –

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Eric, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Eric, um … look, I understand your concern, but right now I think we need to focus on you. Do you know anyone that would want you dead?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: No. But you don’t get to where I am without making a few enemies. When one of my innovations succeeds it often means that someone else’s fails. And the high profile people tend to want things from me, or get angry for things that I can’t control.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well it sounds like being Eric Vaughn has its price.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Don’t get me wrong. I’m not complaining. I’m sure you face much tougher situations every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you know, when someone is trying to kill you I think that you have every right to complain. So what about recently? Have you received any threats?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Not that I’m aware of, but if my people don’t think it’s serious they often don’t bother to tell me. My assistant Petra can get you the file.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll need as much background as she can give us. Disgruntled employees, angry competitors, lawsuits, things like that.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Um … whatever you need. Um, Detective, whoever did this is still out there. It wouldn’t be crazy to assume they might try again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Uh, no it wouldn’t. Look, I can assign some uniformed officers to you. But I think until we find out who’s behind this you might consider hiring private security.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And there you go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s just me not taking you for granted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what did you talk about, then? You and Vaughn?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, we were just going over the investigation, talking out the next few st-

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute – are you – is this you being jealous?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jealous? Yes. The guy won a McArthur Genius Award. You know who they give those awards to? Geniuses. Okay? He’s got one company bringing clean water to Africa and another one that might actually cure cancer. So yes, when you’re in a room with him, alone, I’m a little jealous. I saw – I saw how you looked at him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my gosh, Castle, it’s Eric Vaughn. He was voted one of the hundred most interesting people on the planet. Of course I’m going to swoon. A little. Just like you would if Bar Refaeli walked through the door. But it’s meaningless.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re right. It’s just – the guy’s so impressive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But he’s not you. Besides, the guy could get any woman he wants. He’s not interested in me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Okay, I spoke with the Commissioner and he’s agreed to provide Vaughn with a protective detail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. I actually have a few uniforms that I’d like to recommend for duty.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No. Mr. Vaughn has requested you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He what now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I’m a homicide detective, not some bodyguard.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Trust me, I know. But this comes directly from the Commissioner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why doesn’t Vaughn just hire a private army? He can afford that.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t know why, Mr. Castle. I just know what my orders are. He wants Detective Beckett and only Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can he do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think he just did.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett’s hanging with Vaughn? Hell yeah you should be worried. His hit list includes half of Maxim’s Hot 100. Oh, and unlike you, his helicopter doesn’t need a remote control.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t listen to him, Castle. Beckett’s loyal to you. She’s not going be seduced by his charms.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you’d let Jenny hang with him, then?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hell no. I wouldn’t let Jenny near that guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks. Okay, but I’m not worried. I’m not. I just – I can’t believe the department is forcing her to hang out with some womanizing rich guy against her will.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s never done that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what we need to do. We need to solve this case and fast, okay. The sooner we catch this killer the sooner we get her away from Vaughn. Where are we on that waiter vest we found in the alley?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU is checking for trace evidence. No fibers and they couldn’t pull any prints off the buttons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Have them do it again. Whoever wore that vest is our killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know. We have done this before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle! Chill. We may have another lead. Uniforms picked up a homeless guy in the alley where that vest was found. He may have seen something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then why aren’t we talking to him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because at the moment he is stupid drunk. Seeing double. We have a better chance of a description once he sobers up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean you’re on it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To make him the best damn cup of coffee he’s ever had.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is a big mistake. The best way for me to keep you alive is to get out there and catch the guy that’s behind this.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: You underestimate yourself, Detective. I’m quite sure you can do both.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And are you willing to bet your life on that? You don’t even know me.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: I know enough. You graduated top of your class. You’re the youngest woman in the history of the NYPD to make detective. You have the highest closure rate of anyone in the department and earlier this year you bucked every protocol to save a senator’s life.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Do you have any idea how remarkable you are?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: You don’t, do you? If anyone can keep me safe, it’s you.

utterance.speaker: DAVID ANDERSON
utterance.content: Good afternoon, Eric. We put extra security in place, but we have to talk about MexiSolar.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, David Anderson, my attorney. The detective is looking after me, so make sure she has everything she needs.

utterance.speaker: DAVID
utterance.content: If he gives you any trouble we can put him on investor conference calls all day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I might take you up on that.

utterance.speaker: DAVID
utterance.content: Eric, it’s important to keep MexiSolar R and D moving if we want a large Q3.

utterance.speaker: PETRA
utterance.content: Detective, I put together summaries of our entire portfolio of companies per you request, along with complaints against them or Mr. Vaughn. Briefing in an hour?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that would be great. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Your cause of death. The poison was a chemical synthesized weaponized agent similar to the organic compound saxitoxin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Saxitoxin?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm. It usually occurs in shellfish, but not this version. Whoever created this had access to a pretty sophisticated lab and this one’s been supercharged. Speaking of supercharged, is it true that you’re with Eric Vaughn? I mean Kate, I know you love Castle and all, but girlfriend –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘bye Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: ‘ello there, Lanie, I’m Eric Vaughn and I think you’re absolutely ravishing.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Saxitoxin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, are you familiar with it?

utterance.speaker: NEIL
utterance.content: The Vaughn Alliance partnered with a university lab to develop the next generation antidote to that entire class of neurotoxins.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And have you had troubles with anyone associated with the lab?

utterance.speaker: PETRA
utterance.content: Cindy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s Cindy?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Cindy Peralty. She’s our lead researcher. A few months ago we were presenting at a conference in Singapore, we had a few drinks, and –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it ended badly. I get it.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Actually it started badly. She expressed some deep seated feelings for me, ones that I didn’t share, so when I declined she took it hard.

utterance.speaker: PETRA
utterance.content: He’s being polite. She went Fatal Attraction for a couple of weeks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you still work with her?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: She’s a very talented researcher. Detective, we’re all mislead by our hearts sometimes. It shouldn’t end a career.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It shouldn’t end a life, either. So where does Cindy live?

utterance.speaker: NEIL
utterance.content: Out by the university labs in lower Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So in the city, near the restaurant. And with access to saxitoxins.

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: I have a PhD in chemistry from MIT. Of course I’ve heard of saxitoxin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pretty dangerous stuff, Cindy. Have you ever worked with any of it?

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: We do. As so a lot of other labs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ms. Peralty, we understand you and Eric Vaughn had a … personal … falling out?

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: Yeah. So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So any hard feelings?

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: It was painful, but I got over it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you? ‘cause that hasn’t been your pattern. You’ve had restraining orders filed against you by three ex-boyfriends. You’ve keyed cars, slashed tires. Straight out of a Carrie Underwood song.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but you know what Carrie Underwood never sang about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Using a chemically enhanced neurotoxin to poison a guy in a restaurant. See, Eric Vaughn, he survived. But one of the other people he was with wasn’t so lucky.

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: Someone tried to kill Eric?

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: No! I would never!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ms. Peralty, you had access to the toxin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where were you last night, Cindy?

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: At the opera. Madame Butterfly. You can check.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so after two cups of coffee, a latte, and three espressos our homeless friend Mr. Hazelton over there finally sobered up. He said he saw who stashed the vest in the dumpster. He said the fellow was dressed in a busboy uniform.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute, are you saying it wasn’t someone from the outside? It was someone that worked at Iago?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right, so I showed him photos of all the Iago employees and he fingered this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Corey Harrison.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait a second. He tried to pin it on somebody else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then he’s lying. Trying to make it look like it was someone from the outside when it was him all along.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would he want to poison Vaughn?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s ask him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Coffee?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I should probably stop, too. One more.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Police!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Over here. Looks like someone else got here first.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Goose down allergy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll live, unlike Cory Harrison. Killer clearly used a pillow as a poor man’s silencer. No sign of forced entry either. Maybe he knew his killer.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He also knew it was coming. I found defensive wounds on Mr. Harrison’s wrists, but that’s all I’m going to find. Someone washed his hands with bleach.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Disposing of DNA and trace evidence? Our shooter sounds like a pro.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. I think I know why he was here.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The lab confirms it. The bottle in Cory Harrison’s apartment contains the toxin that killed Felder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So someone was using him to spike Vaughn’s food and then got rid of him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means somewhere in Harrison’s life, family, financials, or work there’s the key to who’s behind all of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe someone at the restaurant knew what he was up to. We should go back there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You and the boys can go back there Mr. Castle. Beckett’s going to the Fairwick Hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s at the Fairwick?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Eric Vaughn. As long as we have a killer running around, I need him somewhere safe. So, he booked the presidential suite, and from now until the time we catch whoever is behind all this you’re staying with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the presidential suite?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Sir, are you serious? You want me to babysit this guy?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He’s insisting. Apparently you made quite an impression.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Sir, I –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective, I know how you feel. But whoever killed that last boy was a pro, which means he may strike again. And I am not going to lose one of the world’s most influential men on my watch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, it’s one thing to follow him around but quite another to be shacking up with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I am not shacking up with him. I’m just doing my job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t trust me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh no, of course I trust you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you don’t. That’s what this is all about? otherwise this wouldn’t be an issue.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Shall we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Coffee break at a time like this? Really guys?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s your problem, bro?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan, you need to call Jenny and you need to call whoever it is you call because we are not going home until we solve this murder. All right? Let’s get to that restaurant and get some answers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, guys. I mean it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. This is the nicest safe house I’ve ever seen.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Well, if someone’s trying to kill you, you might as well make the most of, eh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I should get to work.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Apologies to NovaTech and lets cancel the MexiSolar trip until summer. Thanks, Petra.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When were you last in contact with Jeff Sussman?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: It’s not Sussman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well you fired him and he was convicted of embezzling. That sounds like a suspect to me.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Look, the guy screwed up and paid for it. But I set his mother up in an assisted living facility. Jeff was very grateful. It’s not him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you expecting anyone?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: I took the liberty of ordering some room service.

utterance.speaker: ROOM SERVICE ATTENDANT
utterance.content: Good evening, ma’am. May I come in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, actually, no. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, given the way that Felder was killed I would prefer if my people oversaw the food preparation.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Then may I at least grab the champagne? It is sealed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay. Fine.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Excuse me. Here.

utterance.speaker: ROOM SERVICE ATTENDANT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll make sure that we get you some food up here.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: That’s okay. We have the essentials.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Pour you a glass?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. Thank you. I’m on duty.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: You take your work seriously. I like that about you. Makes me feel safe.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God! Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Yes, I think you have to protect me from myself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’m going to go get you some ice, okay?

utterance.speaker: BRUNO
utterance.content: Know what? I’m glad Cory’s dead. After what happened the bloody health department shut me down. If I had known that he did I would’ve killed him myself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, except we think whoever put him up to poisoning your food was the one who killed him. You want revenge? Help us find his killer.

utterance.speaker: BRUNO
utterance.content: What do you want to know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you notice anything unusual about Cory the day of the poisoning?

utterance.speaker: BRUNO
utterance.content: Yeah. Son of a b*itch was late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s it?

utterance.speaker: BRUNO
utterance.content: You don’t understand. No one’s late. Ever. It’s one of my rules. I should have fired him on the spot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: BRUNO
utterance.content: The look in his eyes. It was like seeing a ghost. Something happened to him that day. Something bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here. It should help with the swelling.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Yes. But, uh, not my pride. You know, with your bedside manner you could have been a doctor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me? No, no. A lawyer, maybe. I was in pre-law. I could have represented you in your case against the court.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: But instead you became a cop. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, someone close to me was killed and that just … changed things. Changed me.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Mmm. You know, I was supposed to be an architect. No, seriously. But my sister died when I was in college. A heart defect. So I dropped out and invented a new heart valve. That was my first patent. It’s amazing how fate changed lives, isn’t it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I should get back to work.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: At least have a glass of champagne. I mean, I have suffered for it, after all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Fine. Put it that way. Just half a glass, okay?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Go on. Three quarters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We talked to Cory Harrison’s girlfriend. According to her, he was a in a good mood when he left her apartment yesterday morning.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then something must have happened between home and the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: In fact, something did. We took a look at Cory’s routine. Pretty much every morning he left his apartment, picked up his daughter, took her to preschool. Then he’d walk to the bus stop and catch the 10-X from Staten Island into the city.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah! Great! Captain, you’re here. Did you tell her?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I did tell her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. This is the security video footage from the shelter yesterday – show her. Show her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s our busboy, Cory, talking to some guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that is the 10-X bus, but Cory does not get on. He is late for work. He risks getting fired just to talk to this guy.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well what do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing. We can’t get a good look at him. It’s like he knows where the camera is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right, right. But this is where it gets interesting. How do I -?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That one?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Wait. That’s the bottle of poison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. And after he used it to poison the food, I’m betting this guy came back and shot him to tie up loose ends. He’s your killer.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Look, I wish I could help you, but … I simply just don’t know him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, we’ve got to go over that video again. There’s gotta be something in it that’ll help us figure out who he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks as though you two are enjoying yourselves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about pajamas? Homely flannel or skimpy sleep shorts?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my gosh. You’re sounding like my dad dropping me off at summer camp.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did they serve champagne at your summer camp?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was being polite. Castle, do you think I want this? Do you think I asked to be here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think you’re making the best of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know I would rather be with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then, maybe I should stay. We could protect him together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I am not letting you do this. I’m not letting you turn this investigation into some kind of twisted competition. Look, don’t make this harder than it needs to be. Please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. But only because you said please.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Since we can’t get a good look at this guy’s face I’m hoping there’s some other way we might be able to ID him.

utterance.speaker: TECH AGENT TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: Fortunately we’re all much more than our faces, Detective.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Harrison’s driver’s license lists him as 5’10. That other guys looks like he’s 6’2.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Posture is an indication of spine curvature. I’d say it puts him in his early 40s. Watch his hand. He makes two distinct movements. First he grabs Mr. Harrison’s arm, then he passes him the poison spray.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s left handed.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: And look at his neck.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a bandage.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: It could be covering up a recent injury. Or a tattoo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So I think I know how this guy got Cory to poison the food.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t say money. I’ve been through his financials. There’s nothing there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It might be something a lot more personal. I canvassed the preschool that Cory’s daughter attends. A teacher recognized him when I showed her the screen grab. She remembers him hanging around the school the day before.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you think he threatened to hurt the daughter if Cory didn’t poison the food.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It might explain why Cory was so upset when he got to the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where are we on ballistics?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The slug from the crime scene is pretty mangled, but it’s a possible match to another one in the system. We should know more in a few hours.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, Dad. The box said something about a soothing infusion of calming herbs. Anyway, it’s a calm tea. And you need to calm down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How am I supposed to calm down? It’s Eric Vaughn.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, Beckett is over the moon for you. So give her a little credit, huh? It’s no different than when she was protecting Senator Bracken.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re right. Oh, except for the fact when it was Bracken they weren’t having a slumber party at fancy hotel. And let’s face it. Compared to Bracken Eric Vaughn is like George Clooney.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, no. Eric Vaughn is way sexier than Clooney.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What? He is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and Beckett is protecting him at the Fairwick as we speak.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I was just reminding Dad that Beckett is a professional. And totally committed to their relationship.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah … well… … not totally committed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well there isn’t a ring on her finger, is there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Technically she’s not really committed at all. Ta.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to need more of that tea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. Ballistics got multiple matches on the gun used in Cory Harrison’s murder connecting the weapon to four killings outside the state.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so where were those other murders?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Detroit, Chicago, Las Vegas, and Memphis.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There was never enough evidence, but a name did come up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thomas Barber, 42. Used to be a button man with links to organized crime in Chicago. According to his file he’s a freelancer now. I’ll text you his photo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So is this the same guy we saw in the bus stop video?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. He’s a match for height, age, and placement of creepy neck tattoo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Put an APB out for him and start checking plane and train manifests, along with any other transportation systems into the city and keep in mind this guy is a gun for hire. So we find him, we’re going to find whoever put him up to this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh it. Keep you posted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘kay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s gonna be fine.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: I know it is. I’ve worked with the best and you’d run in circled around any of them before your first cup of coffee. I feel completely safe in your care.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After knowing me for just two days?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: No, after knowing you for two minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you think you’ve got me figured out, huh?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Except for one thing. Are you and Castle …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Is it serious?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Yeah, you could say it’s serious.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: But the truth is you don’t really know. Otherwise you wouldn’t have hesitated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s just – we’ve never really talked about it, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We just haven’t.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Then he’s a fool.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s – – it’s just – it’s complicated.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Kate. There’s nothing complicated about meeting a woman like you and knowing what to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get down!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, pack it up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey … Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Castle. I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Thanks Captain. Vaughn’s already back at the precinct. Gates wants to keep him there until we find another safe house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, preferably one without windows that snipers can't shoot through.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, it looks like the shot came from across the street. Uniforms are canvassing for Barber, but so far nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t understand. How did he even know you and Vaughn were here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe he’s been watching us since Vaughn survived the attack at the restaurant?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett, I hate to do this to you, but I need to take your statement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So … where were you standing when the first shot came?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, I was … right over here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah … okay. And where was Vaughn?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right … … here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why was he standing so close?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t understand. The – - wait a minute. If he was standing there, then the bullet would have gone right through his head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did Barber miss?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, before the first shot Vaughn stumbled.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stumbled. Kids and old people stumble. How did he stumble?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. He just did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he are the wrong entrée and then he stumbled at just the right moment to avoid being shot by an assassin through a window. Nobody’s that lucky. What’s going on here, Kate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He kissed me, okay Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think I have all I need here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I’m not going to lie to you. We were talking about you, we were talking about relationships, and then he kissed me. But it didn’t mean anything. At least not to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if he kissed you, why wouldn’t you just push him away?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Which is why he’s not dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. The front desk clerk at the hotel across the street positively identified Thomas Barber. Said he was staying under an assumed name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any sign of him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but the phone records from his room show that he made several calls to a single number. You’ll never guess who Barber was calling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Peralty, some additional information has come to light since you were last here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like the fact that your father was in financial dire straits to the tune of $75 thousand dollars. He nearly lost the family farm and then suddenly he didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: What does that have to do with anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well it may explain why you did something you otherwise wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like turn over a lethal dose of neurotoxin in exchange for the money to pay off that debt?

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: What’s this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re records of phone calls made by Thomas Barber. A contract killer? Phone calls that he made to you.

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: Look, please. I didn’t know he was going to hurt anyone. He told me he was from a rival lab, that they wanted the patent first. I was mad at Eric. And I needed the money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where did you meet?

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: We didn’t. We talked on the phone and I dropped the vial at a prearranged place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you get paid?

utterance.speaker: CINDY
utterance.content: He told me to set up an offshore account. They day after the drop the money just appeared.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys, check it out. The money arrived via a wire transfer. With Cindy’s cooperation we were able to track it to a Mexican energy company called MexiSolar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I heard Eric talk about this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does a Mexican solar company have to do with Eric Vaughn?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He owns it. In fact, the night that Arthur Felder was poisoned he and Eric Vaughn were arranging a site visit to the company because Felder wanted to double up his investment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So whatever’s going on, it has to involve this company.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but Beckett, there’s more. The person who authorized the wire transfer into Cindy’s account was Eric Vaughn. Looks like he’s behind this whole thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That can’t be right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I just got off the phone with the consulate in Tijuana. This company, MexiSolar, doesn’t exist. They shut down the factory in Mexicali months ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is making no sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh contraire, my friends. For the first time this is making perfect sense. MexiSolar is a scam. Eric Vaughn’s been using it to fleece his investors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, Vaughn is worth a billion dollars. He’s not going to be running scams.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh Beckett. That’s what they said about Bernie Madoff. Like Madoff, it’s quite possible Vaughn’s entire empire is a house of cards. If Felder was going to visit MexiSolar he would have found out about the scam. The house of cards would collapse. Eric Vaughn couldn’t have that. And what better way to get away with murder than to make yourself look to be the intended target? Don’t you see? This entire thing is a charade.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s our killer. He played us. Well, mostly you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of all the confessions over all the years, this one is going to hold a special place in my heart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m going in there. Alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we’re a team. And the universe demands that I see him crumble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. This one has to be about putting Vaughn away and nothing else. And don’t worry. He will crumble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leave the blinds open.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: I’m not sure which I should be more disturbed about, that someone tried to shoot my head off or that you pushed me away when I tried to kiss you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Let’s talk about that. About these attempts on your life. About MexiSolar.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: MexiSolar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your company? The one that doesn’t exist?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Of course it exists. I founded it and invested millions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, so did Arthur Felder. $30 million to be exact. And now it’s all gone.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: What is this? A joke?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not a joke. That’s MexiSolar.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: No, no. This is crazy. The company is completely solvent. Our factory is state of the art. I’ve seen cash flow reports, signed contracts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean like these? They’re fraudulent.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: That’s not possible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How is it not possible? You signed them.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: My staff give me dozens of documents to sign every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s your company.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Yes, but I don’t oversee the day to day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then who does?

utterance.speaker: DAVID
utterance.content: That is quite a story, Detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it is. It’s got everything. Larceny, betrayal, murder. And you looting millions from MexiSolar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But since you had Eric Vaughn signing off on all the reports no one took a hard look at the company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Until Arthur Felder wanted to see where his money was going and you couldn’t have that, could you?

utterance.speaker: DAVID
utterance.content: You think I killed Arthur Felder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. But it was Vaughn that you wanted dead. You knew that the paper trail would make it look like he had embezzled money from the company so you hired a hit man. Except he killed the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: DAVID
utterance.content: You have no proof of any of this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t be so sure. The bank that transferred the money to Cindy Peralty captured an IP address and they traced it back to your computer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s over David.

utterance.speaker: DAVID
utterance.content: Look, I didn’t steal that money. I just made some bets with it that underperformed. And I took the new MexiSolar funding and I doubled down. I mean, that’s what Eric would have done. Damn it. The hole just kept getting deeper and deeper. It all would have come out and it would have meant prison. I had no choice.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: It’s amazing how you can know someone for ten years and not really know them at all. And know someone for a few days and feel like you know them so well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you will be happy to know that the Feds caught Thomas Barber trying to cross the Canadian border so … it’s over.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Yeah. I suppose it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take care, Eric.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: You too, Kate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leaving?

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: You know, that’s an extraordinary woman you have there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: ERIC
utterance.content: Do you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it, Castle? I was really comfortable on that couch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s something I need to do. Something that you need to see.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait – no –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cas – I didn’t say that I didn’t want you to play your game again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I know. I have more cords. This is just symbolic. But you’re right. I’ve been taking you for granted. But no longer. Tonight it’s all about me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shouldn’t it be about me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nope. Because tonight it’s all about me – – giving you a romantic, full body message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To the bedroom. C’mon, you’re going to love this.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
